body:
[caption id="" align="aligncenter" width="153" caption="Leila Ben Ali Trabelsi, official portrait"][/caption]
 
 According to French daily Le Monde, quoting French government sources, Leila Ben Ali Trabelsi, Ben Ali's wife, has fled to Dubai then Saudi Arabia with 1.5 ton of gold [Fr]. The gold was supposedly withdrawn from the Central Bank of Tunisia on January 14th, the very day when ex tunisian president Ben Ali and family hastily fled Tunisia. The governor of the Tunisian central bank has denied today this withdrawal, but local bank sources in Tunisia gave details on how the deed seems to have been done. Zinedine Ben Ali allegedly  allowed his wife to leave the bank with 45 million Euros worth of  gold by calling the governor on his phone. She then flew to Dubai, before meeting her fugitive husband in Jeddah, Saudi Arabia.
French Twitterers immediatly pondered the logistics of such a grand theft:

Smael Sebti goes scientific:
 la masse volumique de l'Or est de 19 300 Kg par M3. en gros 1,5T ca fait 0,08m3 #labanquecentraleàZABA
Gold has a volumic mass of 19 300 Kg per cubic meter. Roughly, 1,5Ton represents 0,08 cubic meter #labanquecentraleàZABA

Sandiet takes care of the metrics:
 Une tonne et demi d'or pur ça fait un cube d'une quarantaine de cm de côté - Ça passe assez  inaperçu
 1.5 ton of pure gold is a roughly 40 centimers wide cube - It's pretty easy to hide.
 Renaud Deschamp is a little envious:
 
 Yen a qui n'ont pas peur de payer des excédents de bagages... 
 Some people are truly not scared by excess luggages
 
 If this  theft of state assets is confirmed, many Tunisians would not be really surprised. As early as 2006, ex president Ben Ali had been nicknamed "Ben Ali Baba and the 40 thieves" by local bloggers [fr]. Le Monde reports that French secret services are now trying to assess the chain of events in Tunisia and the exact circumstances of the flight of ex president Ben Ali and his family to Saudi Arabia.
